ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about how to revise and look at my writing from more of an outsider perspective
A better understanding of how to give feedback to writers, and a deeper understanding of what I as a writer want to accomplish.
How to execute an extensive editing process for a feature length screenplay.

I came to really understand some basic film elements like structure and character which helped develop my story. I think that I also found a new appreciation for the art of revision which our professor really emphasized.
I learned a TON throughout this experience - Minhal taught us a lot about exploring our own writing process, revising, and finding our voices. I discovered many things about myself as a writer.
I learned different ways to approach screenwriting and how best to know your story and characters along with making sure everything is cohesive.
I learned more about the revision process and how to support my classmates through it.

Especially the last conversation with Pippa and Ming, this course provided enlightenment in terms of whether or not I actually want to pursue film in the future. It was a good wrap up of my film career at Yale.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think we got a lot of good teaching and feedback but I think there couldve been more opportunity for student collaboration

The structure of this course needs to change. there is no way that everyone can read everyone else's screenplays while also revising their own.

needs to be more about actually teaching screenwriting. students should be working on their projects as homework, and pages should be due like p-sets.

Strengths were Minhals extremely astute and helpful notes. Weaknesses were the entire class structure. We spent too much time looking over our peers work where everyone in class would be zoned out except for the person presenting. We should do more structured exercises rather than giving notes. I think this was a remnant from when Marc taught the course.

The course was great at making sure we revised effectively. Looking at structure first was a great way to do that. Also, I think that workshopping your script every three weeks was very effective because it actually ensure that I was writing and not procrastinating as heavily as I would have with just one big deadline at the end.
The seminar format is great, as was the way we went about revisions (breaking it up by act).

The amount of reading each week could be difficult to keep up with at times alongside work for other classes. At this point in the process, it is pretty individually driven which is both a strength and weakness. Reading some of our pages out loud could have been fun.

the structure of the course could be improved. I think students should be placed in small workshop groups. It's too difficult to keep track of every story, I'd rather do a deep dive into two or three stories and be consistent about working with those same people throughout the semester rather than having to read everyone's story and only vaguely understand on a surface level what they are going for.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend. Minhal is a great professor and you learn a lot from her.
I mean if you're doing a screenplay for your thesis, you kind of have no choice but to take this class....
Yes if you want to do a creative project for your thesis in Film & Media Studies or if youre self-motivated enough to write a screenplay in your free time.
This is a GREAT way to get writing experience and is super fulfilling if you're interested in screenwriting.
Yes
Yes, if they were already planning on writing a feature length screenplay
